N14/3/PSYCH/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX




       88145701

PSYCHOLOGY
HIGHER LEVEL and standard LEVEL
PAPER 1

Thursday 6 November 2014 (afternoon)

2 hours


INSTRUCTIONS to candidates

   Do not turn over this examination paper until instructed to do so.
   Section A: answer all the questions.
   Section B: answer one question.
   The maximum mark for this examination paper is [46 marks].




8814-5701                                                                                             2 pages
                                                              © International Baccalaureate Organization 2014
                                                    –2–                     N14/3/PSYCH/BP1/ENG/TZ0/XX

                                               SECTION A

Answer all questions in this section. Marks will be awarded for focused answers demonstrating accurate
knowledge and understanding of research.

Biological level of analysis

1.    Explain how genetic inheritance may influence one behaviour, with reference to one
      relevant research study.                                                                [8 marks]


Cognitive level of analysis

2.    Outline two principles that define the cognitive level of analysis.                     [8 marks]


Sociocultural level of analysis

3.    Outline social learning theory with reference to one relevant study.                    [8 marks]




                                               SECTION B

Answer one question in this section. Marks will be awarded for demonstration of knowledge and
understanding (which requires the use of relevant psychological research), evidence of critical thinking
(for example, application, analysis, synthesis, evaluation), and organization of answers.

4.    Discuss how and why one particular research method is used at the biological level     [22 marks]
      of analysis.


5.    Discuss how cognitive and biological factors interact in emotion.                      [22 marks]


6.    Evaluate research (theories and/or studies) on conformity to group norms.              [22 marks]




8814-5701
